channel.title: Executing programs, Java

item.title: Executing programs, Java
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

No. Not without a compatibility layer between them. You can start other processes, but you cannot get anything about their state.

Read full topic

item.title: Executing programs, Java
item.dc:creator: @Venomous Venomous`
item.description:
@Venomous wrote:

[quote=“ohokay, post:3, topic:465921”][quote author=Venomous` link=topic=573076.msg4139410#msg4139410 date=1351995986]
http://www.jguru.com/faq/view.jsp?EID=53754
That might help. Use Google.
[/quote]

I mean external programs, not the one i’m executing it from. Plus, it’s not necessarily a Java application.[/quote]
Ah, sorry for the sad misunderstanding.

Read full topic

item.title: Executing programs, Java
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

Is there a way to control the state of the external program? Like its properties such as whether it’s minimized, visible etc…?

Maybe through the command prompt?

I’m using this

try
{
 		Runtime runtime = Runtime.getRuntime() ;
 		Process s1 = runtime.exec("starter.exe") ;
}

Read full topic
